3-Dimensional Visualization¶

Visualizer3D¶

A module with static methods for creating and populating a 3D visualization window with objects such as points, lines, and meshes.

class visualization.Visualizer3D¶

Class containing static methods for visualization. The interface is styled after pyplot. Should be thought of as a namespace rather than a class.

static figure(bgcolor=(1, 1, 1), size=(1000, 1000), *args, **kwargs)¶

Creates a figure.

Parameters:
  • bgcolor (3-tuple) – color of the background with values in [0,1] e.g. (1,1,1) = white
  • size (2-tuple) – size of the view window in pixels
  • args (list) – args of mayavi figure
  • kwargs (list) – keyword args of mayavi figure
static show()¶

Displays a figure and enables interaction.

static clf()¶

Clear the current figure

static points(points, T_points_world=None, color=(0, 1, 0), scale=0.01, subsample=None)¶

Scatters a point cloud in pose T_points_world.

Parameters:
  • points (core.BagOfPoints) – point set to visualize
  • T_points_world (core.RigidTransform) – pose of points, specified as a transformation from point frame to world frame
  • color (3-tuple) – color tuple
  • scale (float) – scale of each point
  • subsample (int) – parameter of subsampling to display fewer points
static normals(normals, points, T_normals_world=None, color=(0, 1, 0), scale=0.01, length=1.0, subsample=None)¶

Scatters a point cloud with surface normals in pose T_normals_world.

Parameters:
  • normals (core.NormalCloud) – normal cloud to visualize
  • points (core.BagOfPoints) – set of points where the normals are rooted (must have the same number of elements as normals)
  • T_normals_world (core.RigidTransform) – pose of points and surface normals, specified as a transformation from normals frame to world frame
  • color (3-tuple) – color tuple
  • scale (float) – scale of each point
  • length (float) – length of each rendered surface normal
  • subsample (int) – parameter of subsampling to display fewer points
static surface(points, triangles, T_points_world=None, color=(0, 1, 0), style='surface')¶

Triangulates a surface specified as a set of points and triangles.

Parameters:
  • points (core.BagOfPoints) – point set to visualize
  • triangles (Nx3 numpy.ndarray) – set of N triangles specified as triplets of integer indices in the points array
  • T_points_world (core.RigidTransform) – pose of points, specified as a transformation from point frame to world frame
  • color (3-tuple) – color tuple
  • style (str) – triangular mesh style, see Mayavi docs
static mesh(mesh, T_mesh_world=RigidTransform(rotation=[[ 1. 0. 0.] [ 0. 1. 0.] [ 0. 0. 1.]], translation=[ 0. 0. 0.], from_frame=obj, to_frame=world), style='wireframe', color=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5), opacity=1.0)¶

Visualizes a 3D triangular mesh.

Parameters:
  • mesh (meshpy.Mesh3D) – mesh to visualize
  • T_mesh_world (core.RigidTransform) – pose of mesh, specified as a transformation from mesh frame to world frame
  • style (str) – triangular mesh style, see Mayavi docs
  • color (3-tuple) – color tuple
  • opacity (float) – how opaque to render the surface
static mesh_stable_pose(mesh, stable_pose, T_table_world=RigidTransform(rotation=[[ 1. 0. 0.] [ 0. 1. 0.] [ 0. 0. 1.]], translation=[ 0. 0. 0.], from_frame=table, to_frame=world), style='wireframe', color=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5), opacity=1.0)¶

Visualizes a 3D triangular mesh.

Parameters:
  • mesh (meshpy.Mesh3D) – mesh to visualize
  • stable_pose (meshpy.StablePose) – stable pose to visualize
  • T_table_world (core.RigidTransform) – pose of table, specified as a transformation from mesh frame to world frame
  • style (str) – triangular mesh style, see Mayavi docs
  • color (3-tuple) – color tuple
  • opacity (float) – how opaque to render the surface
Returns:

pose of the mesh in world frame
Return type:

core.RigidTransform
static pose(T_frame_world, alpha=0.5, tube_radius=0.005, center_scale=0.025)¶

Plots a pose with frame label.

Parameters:
  • T_frame_world (core.RigidTransform) – pose specified as a transformation from the poses frame to the world frame
  • alpha (float) – length of plotted x,y,z axes
  • tube_radius (float) – radius of plotted x,y,z axes
  • center_scale (float) – scale of the pose’s origin
static table(T_table_world=RigidTransform(rotation=[[ 1. 0. 0.] [ 0. 1. 0.] [ 0. 0. 1.]], translation=[ 0. 0. 0.], from_frame=table, to_frame=world), dim=0.16, color=(0, 0, 0))¶

Plots a table of dimension dim in pose T_table_world.

Parameters:
  • T_table_world (core.RigidTransform) – pose of the table in world frame
  • dim (float) – the dimensions of the table
  • color (3-tuple) – color of table
static view(azimuth=None, elevation=None, distance=None, focalpoint=None)¶

Set the camera viewpoint.

Parameters:
  • azimuth (float) – azimuth of the camera in spherical coordinates
  • elevation (float) – elevation of the camera in spherical coordinates
  • distance (float) – distance of camera to the focalpoint
  • focalpoint (3-tuple of float) – point to center the camera on
static set_offscreen(toggle)¶

Set offscreen rendering mode.

Parameters:toggle (bool) – whether or not to render offscreen

Parameters:filename (str) – filename to save image to
